page.title: 19FLORA/FAUNA-BADLUARACH
page.content: THE AREA TO THE WEST OF BADLUARACH IS COVERED WITH HEATHER-DOMINATED MOOR.AMONG THE HEATHER THERE IS A VARIETY OF OTHER FLOWERS-MILKWORT,BOG ASPHODEL,BUTTERWORT,TORMENTIL AND SOME KINDS OF ORCHID.ON DRIER PARTS ,WHERE THE GRASS IS CROPPED DOWN BY THE SHEEP,WILD THYME,CLOVER,VEITCH,HEATH BEDSTRAW AND BIRDSFOOT TREFOIL GROW. ELSEWHERE THERE ARE AREAS OF DEEP BRACKEN.IN SHELTERED CREVICES ABOVE THE SEA THERE ARE PRIMROSES,THRIFT AND SEA-CAMPION. RED DEER ARE PLENTIFUL ON THE HILL ABOVE BADLUARACH AND FOXES ARE FOUND THERE.THERE IS AN ABUNDANCE OF RABBITS DESPITE MYXOMATOSIS.AT THE SHORE OTTERS CAN BE SEEN PLAYING WHILE SEALS SWIM IN THE WATER. THERE ARE BUZZARDS LOCALLY.SEABIRDS INCLUDE BLACKBACKED,BLACK-HEADED AND HERRING GULLS,FULMAR,KITTIWAKE,OYSTER CATCHERS,TERN,SKUA,SHAG AND CORMORANT.
